1.text: ROB VICKERY: It makes people happy and it

2.text:
makes people smile when they see me do the
‘Running Man’.

16.text: COMM: Rob Vickery has one simple mission in

18.text:
life: to bring joy to the world through the
iconic ‘running man’ dance.

24.text: ROB VICKERY: The central philosophy of the

25.text:
‘Running Man’ is to remind people to not
take life so seriously.

31.text: COMM: The 44-year-old Aussie has danced his

32.text:
way through 14 different countries, posting
videos along the way for a growing fan base.

38.text: ROB VICKERY: I love the one I did in Rhodes

39.text:
on this diving platform in the middle of the
sea. That was fun! “Stepping right there,

43.text:
swim out and gonna get a bit of running man
action going on on that board.”

51.text:
one from Istanbul. I just really love the
different sites and the different locations

57.text: COMM: Rob gave up everything to carry out

59.text:
his dream, and has a very personal reason
for doing so.

62.text: ROB VICKERY: The driving force was my, my

63.text:
grandmother. She raised me and she was, she
was like a mother to me and she’s pretty

68.text:
much the person in my family that I, I love
the most! In November 2012 she died, she was

75.text:
97 and I was there by her side when she died.
It was a very transformative time in my life.

81.text:
I, I, I often say that one life ended and
another life began. I left Australia, I didn’t

87.text: know what I was doing, or where I was going.

90.text: COMM: Having honed the popular dance in the

95.text: ROB VICKERY: So it started with Singapore

96.text:
in February this year. And I was just walking
along the boardwalk with my friends, I just

100.text:
got the inspiration to say, “Film me doing
the ‘Running Man’ in front of Marina Bay Sands.”

106.text: COMM: Rob vows to keep going, despite a close

108.text: brush with the law in Athens.

110.text: ROB VICKERY: Got some great footage and I

111.text:
heard a whistle blowing in the background,
and a lady came over and basically told me

115.text:
that I had to delete it, and If I didn’t
delete it, it would go further and I could

119.text:
get arrested. I started in Asia, travelled
through Singapore and Malaysia, Kuala Lumpur

131.text: ROB VICKERY: And Nepal, Kathmandu. Then after

136.text:
that I came across to Europe to Amsterdam
and down to, to Greece, to Rhodes.

145.text: ROB VICKERY: I tell them my story, I tell

146.text:
them just to remind people to have fun and
not take life so seriously. It’s usually

149.text: pretty easy to get people involved.

155.text: COMM: And Rob The Running Man doesn’t plan

157.text: to hang up his dancing shoes anytime soon.

160.text: ROB VICKERY: A common question they often

161.text:
ask is, “When are you coming home?” Which
I answer, “Well, I am home, because feels

167.text: like the world is my home now.”
